message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $60.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $50. Can you meet me halfway?

I understand your budget constraints, Bob, but I'm not comfortable going that low. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my original offer, so I'll counter with a price of $70. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really love the product.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to go down to $65?
I'm getting close to my minimum acceptable price, Bob. I'm willing to go down to $68, but that's as low as I can go. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll really love the product.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to go down to $65 again?

I'm not willing to go back to $65, Bob. I think we're getting close to a deal, though. I'll meet you halfway between my last offer and your last offer, so I'll counter with a price of $67. It's a fair compromise, and I think you'll really love the product.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to go down to $66?

I'm not willing to go down to $66, Bob. I think we're really close to a deal, though. I'll meet you halfway between my last offer and your last offer, so I'll counter with a price of $66.50. It's a fair compromise, and I think you'll really love the product.
I'm not willing to go above $65, Alice. I think we're really close to a deal, but I need to stay within my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $65?
